### v03: Implement map()

Projecting an array is very common. `map` allows to do it easily

``` js
Array.prototype.map = function(projectionFunction) {
  var results = [];
  this.forEach(function(itemInArray) {
    results.push(projectionFunction(itemInArray));

  });

  return results;
};
...
``` 

### v06: Querying Trees

Simple arrays are flat. Trees are nested arrays. We cannot use `filter` and `map` directly because they are designed for flat arrays. We need to first flatten trees into flat arrays.


``` js
var listsOfItems = [
  {
    name: "list01",
    items: [
      {
        "id": 1,
        "title": "a",
        "rating": 4.0,
      },
      {
        "id": 2,
        "title": "b",
        "rating": 5.0,
      },
    ]
  },
  {
    name: "list02",
    items: [
      {
        "id": 5,
        "title": "e",
        "rating": 3.0,
      },
      {
        "id": 7,
        "title": "f",
        "rating": 5.0,
      },
    ]
  }
];
var result = [];
listsOfItems.forEach( list => {
  list.items.forEach( e => 
    result.push(e.id) 
  );
});
console.log(result);
// [ 1, 2, 5, 7 ]
```

### v07: Implement `concatAll`

`concatAll` expects each item in the array to be another array.

``` js
Array.prototype.concatAll = function() {
  var results = [];
  this.forEach(function(subArray) {
    results.push.apply(results, subArray);
  });

  return results;
};
// JSON.stringify([ [1,2,3], [4,5,6], [7,8,9] ].concatAll()) === "[1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9]"
// [1,2,3].concatAll(); // throws an error because this is a one-dimensional array
``` 


### v09: Implement `concatMap`

Note that, `map` and `concatAll` are chained together frequently. 

Usually, when we flatten a tree we chain `map` and `concatAll`. Let `concatMap` do a `map` followed by a `concatAll`

``` js
Array.prototype.concatMap = function(projectionFunctionThatReturnsArray) {
  return this.
    map(function(item) {
      return projectionFunctionThatReturnsArray(item);
    }).
    // apply the concatAll function to flatten the two-dimensional array
    concatAll();
};
var words = [ ["cero","rien"], ["uno","un"] ];
var allWords = [0,1].concatMap( (index) =>
  words[index]
);
console.log(allWords);
// [ 'cero', 'rien', 'uno', 'un' ]
```

### v12: Implement `reduce`

``` js
Array.prototype.reduce = function(combiner, initialValue) {
  var counter,
    accumulatedValue;

  // If the array is empty, do nothing
  if (this.length === 0) {
    return this;
  }
  else {
    // If the user didn't pass an initial value, use the first item.
    if (arguments.length === 1) {
      counter = 1;
      accumulatedValue = this[0];
    }
    else if (arguments.length >= 2) {
      counter = 0;
      accumulatedValue = initialValue;
    }
    else {
      throw "Invalid arguments.";
    }

    // Loop through the array, feeding the current value and the result of
    // the previous computation back into the combiner function until
    // we've exhausted the entire array and are left with only one function.
    while(counter < this.length) {
      accumulatedValue = combiner(accumulatedValue, this[counter])
      counter++;
    }

    return [accumulatedValue];
  }
};
var r = [1,2,3].reduce( (acc, x) => acc + x )
console.log(r)
var r2 = [1,2,3].reduce( (acc, x) => acc + x, 10 )
console.log(r2)
```

### v15: Converting an Array to a Map Using Reduce

``` js
var videos = [
  {
    "id": 65432445,
    "title": "The Chamber"
  },
  {
    "id": 675465,
    "title": "Fracture"
  },
  {
    "id": 70111470,
    "title": "Die Hard"
  },
  {
    "id": 654356453,
    "title": "Bad Boys"
  }
];
var r = videos.
  reduce( 
    (acc, x) => {
      var obj = {};
      obj[x.id] = x.title;
      return Object.assign(acc, obj);
    }, {});
console.log(r)
// [ { '675465': 'Fracture',
//     '65432445': 'The Chamber',
//     '70111470': 'Die Hard',
//     '654356453': 'Bad Boys' } ]
```

### v18: Implement `zip`

``` js
Array.zip = function(left, right, combinerFunction) {
	var counter,
		results = [];

	for(counter = 0; counter < Math.min(left.length, right.length); counter++) {
		results.push(combinerFunction(left[counter],right[counter]));
	}

	return results;
};
var r = Array.zip(
	[1,2,3],
	[4,5,6], 
	(left, right) => left + right 
)
console.log(r)
// [ 5, 7, 9  ]
```

### v19: Zipping Arrays with `zip`

``` js
var videos = [
  {
    "id": 1,
    "title": "a"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "title": "b"
  },
];
var bookmarks = [
    {id: 101, time: 20},
    {id: 102, time: 40},
  ]
var r = Array.zip(
	videos,
	bookmarks,
	(video, bookmark) =>
		({videoId: video.id, bookmarkId: bookmark.id})
``` 
